instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2523: What is 820-2523? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> delayed backlight
threads.message: Hi i have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, which came in with no backlight, when probing for <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR>, i got an backlight when pinching the pin of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR>, so I resolder all the pin with leaded solder, now backlight is turning on, but its a bit delayed, like if it just wake up from a sleep, it need a few minutes to wake up the backlight ( image is present ),

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> delayed backlight
threads.message: We need some signals and voltages from backlight area in that moment...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> delayed backlight
threads.message: ok.. so the actual symptom is.., backlight is turning normally, but if i make it sleep with closing the lid, and opening it, display doesnt come out  anymore,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> delayed backlight
threads.message:
Sorry i mean <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
I have tried removing bil flex, but still same, backlight will be gone and comeback intermittenly every minutes
If there’s no backlight, 
Lvds looks clean
Ppvout is 0v
<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> 0v
There is a greenish color at the edge glue for <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, does this have something to do with mux ?
